critique: The executive order is a technical document that redefines an item for the Generalized System of Preferences. It is unlikely to evoke strong emotions. The order is factual and procedural, aiming for clarity and precision rather than emotional impact. Therefore, the scores for all emotions should be low. I will set joy, sadness, anger, fear, disgust, and surprise all to 1 initially. After further consideration, I still believe that the emotional impact is minimal, so I will keep the scores at 1.
